chart.name: Number of Databases
chart.programText: A = data('dtu_consumption_percent', filter=filter('primary_aggregation_type', 'true') and filter('resource_type', 'Microsoft.Sql/servers/databases'), extrapolation='last_value', maxExtrapolations=2).mean(by=['azure_resource_id']).count().publish(label='A')

chart.description: Database Transaction Units are a blended measure of metrics to predict overall performance of the resource. Consider upgrading if values persist near or over 100%
chart.name: DTU Percentage Trend
Top Databases by Total Storage
chart.programText: A = data('storage', filter=filter('primary_aggregation_type', 'true') and filter('resource_type', 'Microsoft.Sql/servers/databases'), rollup='latest', extrapolation='last_value', maxExtrapolations=5).mean(by=['azure_resource_id', 'azure_resource_name']).top(count=5).publish(label='A')

chart.description: Consistent values larger than 100% means a larger performance tier should be considered
chart.name: Top Databases by DTU Consumption %
Connections Blocked by Firewall
chart.programText: A = data('blocked_by_firewall', filter=filter('primary_aggregation_type', 'true'), rollup='latest', extrapolation='zero', maxExtrapolations=5).publish(label='A')

chart.name: SQL Server CPU %
chart.programText:
A = data('cpu_percent', filter=filter('primary_aggregation_type', 'true') and filter('resource_type', 'Microsoft.Sql/servers/databases')).publish(label='A', enable=False)
B = (A).min().publish(label='B')
C = (A).percentile(pct=10).publish(label='C')
D = (A).percentile(pct=50).publish(label='D')
E = (A).percentile(pct=90).publish(label='E')
F = (A).max().publish(label='F')

dashboard.description: An overview for multiple Azure SQL Databases
dashboard.name: Azure SQL Databases

dashboard.description: Charts to monitor an individual Azure SQL Database
dashboard.name: Azure SQL Database
